fields.title: Atomic Habits
fields.author: James Clear
fields.description: A practical, evidence-based guide to building better habits and breaking bad ones through tiny changes that compound into remarkable results.

fields.author: George Orwell
fields.description: A dystopian classic that explores surveillance, totalitarianism, and the power of language in a chilling future society.

fields.title: The Night Circus
fields.author: Erin Morgenstern
fields.description: A magical, atmospheric fantasy about a mysterious competition between two illusionists set in a wandering, enchanting circus.

fields.title: Dune
fields.author: Frank Herbert
fields.description: Epic world-building on a desert planet with politics, prophecy, and ecological intrigue at the heart of an interstellar struggle.

fields.title: Neuromancer
fields.author: William Gibson
fields.description: Cyberpunk foundational novel blending hacking, artificial intelligence, and dystopia in a high-tech noir narrative.

fields.title: The Name of the Wind
fields.author: Patrick Rothfuss
fields.description: A lyrical coming-of-age tale of a gifted young magician recounting his journey from orphan to legend.

fields.title: The Priory of the Orange Tree
fields.author: Samantha Shannon
fields.description: A standalone epic fantasy with dragons, political intrigue, and matriarchal power structures.

fields.title: Gone Girl
fields.author: Gillian Flynn
fields.description: A gripping psychological thriller about a missing wife and the unraveling secrets of a marriage.

fields.title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
fields.author: Stieg Larsson
fields.description: Complex mystery pairing a journalist and a fierce hacker to solve a decades-old disappearance.

fields.title: The Book Thief
fields.author: Markus Zusak
fields.description: Set in Nazi Germany, a young girl finds solace in stealing books and sharing them as the world around her crumbles.

fields.title: All the Light We Cannot See
fields.author: Anthony Doerr
fields.description: Beautifully written story of a blind French girl and a German soldier whose paths converge during WWII.

fields.title: Educated
fields.author: Tara Westover
fields.description: A powerful memoir about a woman who escapes an isolated, fundamentalist upbringing to pursue education against all odds.

fields.title: Born a Crime
fields.author: Trevor Noah
fields.description: Humorous and moving reflections on the author’s childhood growing up mixed-race in apartheid South Africa.

fields.title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
fields.author: Yuval Noah Harari
fields.description: A sweeping overview of human history through anthropology, biology, and economic shifts.

fields.title: The Body: A Guide for Occupants
fields.author: Bill Bryson
fields.description: An entertaining and informative tour of the human body — how it works and why it’s amazing.

fields.title: Mindset: The New Psychology of Success
fields.author: Carol S. Dweck
fields.description: Explores how a “growth mindset” transforms learning, resilience, and achievement.

fields.title: The Power of Now
fields.author: Eckhart Tolle
fields.description: A spiritual guide about embracing the present moment to transcend anxiety and find peace.

fields.title: Good to Great
fields.author: Jim Collins
fields.description: Examines why some companies make the leap to sustained success and others don’t.

fields.title: Start With Why
fields.author: Simon Sinek
fields.description: A framework for inspiring leadership rooted in purpose: understanding why drives extraordinary success.

fields.title: The Sun and Her Flowers
fields.author: Rupi Kaur
fields.description: A modern poetry collection exploring growth, healing, ancestry, and love with raw emotional clarity.

fields.title: Can't Hurt Me
fields.author: David Goggins
fields.description: A brutal yet inspiring memoir about transforming pain into power through relentless discipline.

fields.title: Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experience
fields.author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi
fields.description: Explores how to achieve deep focus and fulfillment by entering “flow,” a state of complete immersion.

fields.title: Digital Minimalism
fields.author: Cal Newport
fields.description: A practical guide to reducing digital distraction so you can focus on what truly matters.

fields.title: The Miracle Morning
fields.author: Hal Elrod
fields.description: A structured morning routine designed to reduce stress and increase clarity, energy, and productivity.

fields.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck
fields.author: Mark Manson
fields.description: A counterintuitive guide to prioritizing what actually matters and letting go of the rest.

fields.title: The Anxiety and Phobia Workbook
fields.author: Edmund J. Bourne
fields.description: A practical self-help workbook with exercises to reduce anxiety and regain control (very helpful if overwhelmed).

fields.title: The Upside of Stress
fields.author: Kelly McGonigal
fields.description: Reframes stress as something that can make you stronger rather than break you.

fields.title: The Book of Joy
fields.author: Dalai Lama
fields.description: A heart-warming dialogue about finding joy and peace even amid suffering.

fields.title: Braiding Sweetgrass
fields.author: Robin Wall Kimmerer
fields.description: Lyrical essays blending ecology and indigenous wisdom about gratitude, belonging, and connection to nature.

fields.title: The 5 Second Rule
fields.author: Mel Robbins
fields.description: A simple tool to beat hesitation, push past fear, and take action — in 5 seconds.

fields.title: Letters to a Young Poet
fields.author: Rainer Maria Rilke
fields.description: Timeless meditations on creativity, solitude, and self-belief.

fields.title: Tiny Beautiful Things
fields.author: Cheryl Strayed
fields.description: Compassionate real-life advice that’s grounding and unexpectedly uplifting.
